    SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Warehouse execution

    TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction to Warehouse execution Mobile App Mobile App WMS settings Serialnumbers / Lotnumbers SupplyChain365 WMS workflows Break-bulk Create License Plates Change location Receive Put-Away Order picking Zone / Batch / Tote picking Movements / Replenishment Ad hoc movements Shipments Loading/unloading Inventory/Counting Bin content Article availability Adjust units of measurement Kitting – make/break Licenseplate Printing labels Connect Bluetooth scanning devices Block Items, Serialnumber & Lotnumbers

    Introduction to Warehouse execution The SupplyChain365 Warehouse and Logistics solution consists of the Extension and the mobile application.

    Mobile App Use SupplyChain365 mobile App on Android mobile scanning device to perform warehouse activities.

    Mobile App WMS settings Set parameters for each warehouse activity and automate the logistics flow per warehouse location.

    Serialnumbers / Lotnumbers Register serial and lot numbers using barcode scanning or RFID on the mobile device with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP.

    SupplyChain365 WMS workflows Automate warehouse transactions and automatically create documents and warehouse activities by arranging a workflow and providing parameters.

    Break-bulk Change the packaging unit in the logistics process (from pallets to boxes from boxes to pieces) by using the break-bulk function.

    Create License Plates Create license plates (logistics units: pallets/containers, etc.) and move large amounts of stock on entry, storage and removal with one barcode scan.

    Change location Create settings by warehouse/branch assign warehouse users and easily switch between locations.

    Receive Receive of goods and automatic booking of warehouse receipts including Licenseplates, serial and lot number registration. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode.

    The mobile process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings: Require receive item scan, Scan receive bin first, Batch Posting, Require scan every item, Allow over-receipt, Enable scanning of serial numbers, Use Suggested CrossDockBin in receiving, Scanning of a serial number is required, Enable license plate recording.

    Put-Away Storage of goods in the warehouse using barcode scanning. Register which goods are placed at which storage locations (bins). Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode.

    The mobile process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings: Place all Items, Enable scanning of serial numbers, Always automatically create a put-away, Create a put-away when receipt complete, Different Bin confirm required, Scanning of a Serial number is required.

    Order picking Process pick jobs using the SupplyChain365 WMS APP on mobile devices with barcode scanners. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. The mobile process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings: Auto open Header, Auto open Line, Place all Items, Enable scanning of serial numbers, Different Bin confirm required, Scanning of a serial number is required, Breakbulk flow required.

    Zone / Batch / Tote picking Collect multiple orders in one run and place items directly in shipping boxes or crates with one or more boxes/crates per order. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode.

    Movements / Replenishment Move inventory in the warehouse, process replenishment tasks with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. The mobile process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings: Auto open Header, Auto open Line, Place all Items, Enable scanning of serial numbers, Different Bin confirm required, Scanning of a serial number is required

    Ad hoc movements Register ad hoc movements with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP and process them automatically. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode.

    Shipments Book warehouse shipments and print labels and packing slips with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode.

    Loading/unloading Use loading lists when WMS works with TMS for loading and unloading shipments. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode.

    Inventory/Counting Create periodic inventory counting lists and check the stock status using the barcode scanning and the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode.

    Bin content Check the contents of a storage location (bin) using the SupplyChain365 WMS APP.

    Article availability Search for items at warehouse storage locations by scanning item number or barcode with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP.

    Adjust units of measurement Add units of measure to items or adjust units of measure. For example: length, width, height, weaving, packaging.

    Kitting – make/break Licenseplate Use the mobile app to pack items together from a single order or to repack items in new packaging. The consumption of packaging material and a new license plate can be activated.

    Printing labels Print barcode/RFID labels in any warehouse process of items, orders, order lines, serial numbers, lot numbers and license plates.

    Connect Bluetooth scanning devices Use external Bluetooth scanners and connect them to the SupplyChain365 APP on the mobile device.

    Block Items, Serialnumber & Lotnumbers Items, Serialnumbers and Lotnumbers may be blocked for further logistics handling (picking, shipping, receiving etc.)

    Why we love Cookies

    We use cookies to try and give you a better experience in Supplychain365.

    You can learn more about what kind of cookies we use, why, and how from our Privacy policy. If you hate cookies, or are just on a diet, you can disable them altogether too. Just note that the Freshdesk service is pretty big on some cookies (we love the choco-chip ones), and some portions of Freshdesk may not work properly if you disable cookies.

    We’ll also assume you agree to the way we use cookies and are ok with it as described in our Privacy policy, unless you choose to disable them altogether through your browser.
